caption:
The photograph depicts a series of large electrical transmission towers set against a dusky sky. These towers, constructed from metal frameworks, are in a line receding into the distance towards a mountain range. The mountains in the background create a dark, silhouette-like appearance due to the lighting conditions, possibly at either sunrise or sunset.

The towers are interlinked by multiple heavy electrical wires that hang in curves from the top of one tower to another. The scene captures a blend of human engineering and natural landscape, emphasizing the scale and reach of electrical infrastructure across geographic areas. The overall mood evoked by the image is somewhat solemn and quiet, underlined by the smooth gradient of the sky fading from a lighter near the horizon to a darker blue above, and the absence of any human activity visible. The perspective and composition focus on the linear arrangement of the towers and the dim lighting adds a layer of mystery to the landscape.
title: Transmission lines near Searchlight, Nevada. (From the Documerica-1 exhibition. For other images in this assignment, see fiche numbers 87, 88, 106, 107, 108, 109, 110, 111)
